snippet: A White House official said Mr. Duncan, a member of President Obama’s original cabinet, would be replaced by John B. King Jr., a former commissioner of education in New York State.

byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from Washington, and Motoko Rich from New York.
byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and MOTOKO RICH

abstract: Education Sec Arne Duncan, arguably one of most powerful people to hold position and key member of Pres Obama's cabinet, announces he will resign in December; Obama says he will nominate Deputy Education Sec John B King Jr in Duncan's place.
lead_paragraph: A White House official said Mr. Duncan, a member of President Obama’s original cabinet, would be replaced by John B. King Jr., a former commissioner of education in New York State.

headline.print_headline: Education Secretary Announces Exit From Cabinet
headline.main: Arne Duncan, Education Secretary, to Step Down in December
